title: CCE Course Template
content:
Before beginning integration, copy all componeents from the CCE Course Template in Avenue into your course master shell.
If you are not able to access the CCE Course Template in Avenue contact an LST. You are required to have a MacID to access Avenue.
Manage Files The following table provides a breakdown of the various files and folders in the Manage Files(Course Admin > Manage Files) area of the CCE Course Template.
The first column lists the Folder Name. The second column provides a summary of what is in each folder.   Location Purpose    Avenue/code CSS, javascript and icon code files.  Avenue/code/css CSS and font icon files.  All HTML pages refer to the main.min.css for styling. You will also find additional main.min.css(program) files. These are not linked to any HTML files. Based on the course that you are working on, rename the file that you need. For example for a business course I would rename "main.min.css(business)" to "main.min.css".   Avenue/toc Module pages that appear directly in the table of contents are stored here.  Avenue/media Any additional files in the course such as images, documents or html pages that are hyperlinked from a module are stored here. This includes readings and transcripts.    Browse through the CCE Course Template content to familiarize yourself with the structure of a page.
Custom CSS Classes Custom CSS classes have been added to the stylesheet.
List Types The list type attribute is obsolete. To accomodate custom list types the following classes are available.
Ordered lower-alpha  upper-alpha  lower-roman  upper-roman  Unordered noType 
circle 
square 
Hyperlinks Hyperlinks that are pointing to external content, not hosted in Avenue, must open in a new tab. Thet must also include an additional class and text for screen readers in a <span> attribute.
The <span> attribute should not be included on any hyperlinks that don’t have the cce stylesheet attached. For example, if there is a link in the description of a discussion topic, exclude the <span> attribute.
<a href="http://example.com" target="_blank">Example link<span class="sr-only"> (opens in a new tab)</span></a>  Hyperlinks that are pointing to internal content, hosted in Avenue, should open in the same tab.
<a href="http://example.com">Example link</a>  Evaluations Module The files in this module should be Word files (.doc or .docx) unless otherwise specified by the ID.

title: Dropbox
content:
We use Dropbox to share files. The following table lists the files that you will use for integration located in the Dropbox/CCE Development - Templates/6. LST Templates folder. If you have not been added to our Dropbox contact an LST.
The files in the Dropbox get updated frequently. Always grab a new copy of these files before beginning integration of a course.
 Location Purpose    Default Turnitin Settings.docx Contains the standard Turnitin settings that we configure for all Assignment folders. If you did not receive any specific configuration settings for Turnitin in your course, refer to this document and deafult to these settings.   Master QA Checklist.xlsx Contains a checklist of items to complete when integrating a course.   Template Changes Log.xlsx Documentation of updates to our CCE Template in Avenue. Refer to this near the end of integration to see if any of the pages have been udpate. If you are unsure weather or not you should update any   Tool Settings.docx Template for documenting tool settings that need to be configured in the course. Use this when you meet with the ID to discuss tool settings.   TEMPLATE_101 Contains a folder titled Avenue with a copy of the CCE Course Template content files in Avenue. While you can use these files as a starting point to develop webpages, it is reccomended that you copy all components from the CCE Template in Avenue to your course using the Import/Export/Copy feature. This will ensure that settings are copied and configured correctly in your course.

title: Shared Files
content: Shared Files Before beginning integration you will need to download several files. This section contains details on where these are located and the purpose that they serve.

title: CCE Course Template
content: CCE Course Template The CCE Course Template in Avenue contains all of the neccessary files and Grade settings to begin integrating a course. This section contains information about the template.

title: Internal Files
content:
The following information is for internal LSTs.
Below you will find details on where internal network share files are located and the purpose that they serve.
 Location Purpose    N:\CCE Course Development Internal course development team folder.  N:\CCE Course Development\Courses Within a particular course folder there are course development files and a copy of all of the files as the appear in the Manage Files area of the course in Avenue.  Google Account used for hosting course videos and host the Course Development Hub site.  Contact an LST to get access to these accounts.

title: Program Colours
content:
The following program colours are used in the CCE Templates.
The desaturated and secondary colours are not selectable as CSS classes. The secondary colour is used as the icon colours for certain headings. The desaturated colour is auto SASS generated based on the primary colour. It is used for table headings where text is white.

title: Course Development Documentation
content:
Course Development Documentation Welcome to the McMaster CCE Course Development Team. Your primary role in the development process will be to integrate courses into our instance of the Brightspace LMS, Avenue to Learn.
Read through the documentation to familiraize yourself with our processes, where to find things, and what needs to be completed during intergation.
